member.name: T:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation
member.summary:
The DatumTransformation object defines a horizontal geodetic datum transformation model and defines its parameters for the transformation of coordinates between different horizontal geodetic datums.
When building AltCoordSystemPaths within a CoordSystemsMgr object, you can build a DatumTransformation object automatically. The algorithm for building a datum transformation automatically is controlled by the file /cssruntm/cfg/autodt.ini. This file is well documented and can be modified to change the algorithm.

remarks.see: Notes for the Canadian National Transformation (2.0)
Notes for NADCON NAD27 to NAD83 and NADCON NAD83 to HARN

member.name: M:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.CopyTo(Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation)
member.summary: Copies all of the properties of this DatumTransformation object to the destination object.
member.param: The destination object receiving the copied characteristics

member.name: M:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.IsTransformationValid(Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.CSPointConstants,System.Int32,Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.CSPointConstants,System.Int32)
member.summary: Validates whether a proposed transformation can be performed by the object.
member.param: Point type from the CSPointConstants enumeration for the points to transform
A value designating the reference space of the input points
Point type from the CSPointConstants enumeration for the transformed points
A value designating the reference space of the output points
member.returns: If the transformation is possible, this method returns true. If the transformation is not possible, this method returns false.
member.remarks:
Use the value 1 to identify the reference space of the Forward Input Space Geodetic Datum and the value 2 to identify the reference space of the Forward Output Space Geodetic Datum.
Which point type combinations are valid depends on the current datum transformation model.

member.name: M:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.TransformPoint(Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.CSPointConstants,System.Int32,Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.CSPointConstants,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Transforms a single point between different reference spaces according to the capabilities of the object and the method’s parameters.
The TransformPoint method accepts a single point (specified as X, Y, and Z coordinate values) to transform, accepts the input and output point types, and accepts input and output reference space identifiers as input. The method returns the X, Y, and Z coordinate values of the transformed point, using the same parameters as used for the input coordinate values.
member.param: Point type from the CSPointConstants enumeration for the points to transform
A value designating the reference space of the input points
Point type from the CSPoint constants enumeration for the transformed points
A value designating the reference space of the output points
On Input, the X coordinate value of the point to be transformed. On output, the transformed X coordinate value
On Input, the Y coordinate value of the point to be transformed. On output, the transformed Y coordinate value
On Input, the Z coordinate value of the point to be transformed. On output, the transformed Z coordinate value
member.remarks:
Use the value 1 to identify the reference space of the Forward Input Space Geodetic Datum and the value 2 to identify the reference space of the Forward Output Space Geodetic Datum.
Which point type combinations are valid depends on the current datum transformation model.

member.name: M:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.TransformPoints(Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.CSPointConstants,System.Int32,Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.CSPointConstants,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary:
Transforms coordinates between different reference spaces according to the capabilities of the object and the method’s parameters.
The TransformPoints method accepts an array of points to transform, accepts the input and output point types, and accepts input and output reference space identifiers as input. The method returns the transformed coordinates, using the same array of points as used for input.
member.param: Point type from the CSPoint constants enumeration for the points to transform
A value designating the reference space of the input points
Point type from the CSPointConstants enumeration for the transformed points
A value designating the reference space of the output points
A single-dimensional array containing the points to transform. Each point is stored as a set of 3 consecutive elements representing X, Y, and Z coordinates respectively.
member.remarks:
Use the value 1 to identify the reference space of the Forward Input Space Geodetic Datum and the value 2 to identify the reference space of the Forward Output Space Geodetic Datum.
Which point type combinations are valid depends on the current datum transformation model.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.BursaWolf
member.summary: Returns the BursaWolf object for a DatumTransformation object. This object defines parameters specific to the Bursa-Wolf geodetic datum transformation model. Only valid if the ModelTypeVal property has the value csdtBursaWolf.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.ComplexPolynomial
member.summary: Returns the ComplexPolynomial object for a DatumTransformation object. This object defines parameters specific to the Complex Polynomial geodetic datum transformation model. Only valid if the ModelTypeVal property has the value csdtComplexPolynomial.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.DatumTransModelTypeStrings
member.summary: Returns a collection that enumerates the list of available horizontal geodetic datum transformation models.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.Description
member.summary: The Description property is an information string that can be used to hold additional information about the coordinate system, such as source and accuracy.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.Direction
member.summary: Defines the direction of the forward datum transformation equations with regard to space identification numbers. The property defines whether the forward datum transformation equations transform from the lower space ID number to the higher space ID number or vice versa.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.ForwardInputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr
member.summary:
Sets the forward input space horizontal geodetic datum used by the DatumTransformation object by specifying a character string from a list of standard (predefined) or named (configurable) geodetic datum character string names. This property also returns the character string for the currently assigned forward input space horizontal geodetic datum.
When transforming in the forward direction, this is the source geodetic datum.
When you use the ForwardInputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property to set the forward input space geodetic datum, the string assigned to this property must be an alphanumeric character string that matches one of those within the GeodeticDatumStrings collection.
member.remarks: Named horizontal geodetic datums are defined in the NamedHDatum.ini configuration file.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.ForwardInputSpaceGeodeticDatumVal
member.summary:
Sets the forward input space horizontal geodetic datum used by the DatumTransformation object by assigning a predefined horizontal geodetic datum constant to the property. This property also returns the constant value for the currently assigned forward input space horizontal geodetic datum.
When transforming in the forward direction, this is the source geodetic datum.
member.remarks: This property cannot be used to specify a named datum from the NamedHDatum.ini configuration file. The ForwardInputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property must be used to specify a named datum. When the ForwardInputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property is used to specify a named datum, this property will return the value csgdNamed, which by itself is an ambiguous definition of the forward input space horizontal geodetic datum. When the value csgdNamed is obtained, the caller must then reference the ForwardInputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property to obtain a nonambiguous definition of the forward input space geodetic datum.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.ForwardOutputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr
member.summary:
Sets the forward output space horizontal geodetic datum used by the DatumTransformation object by specifying a character string from a list of standard (predefined) or named (configurable) geodetic datum character string names. This property also returns the character string for the currently assigned forward output space horizontal geodetic datum.
When transforming in the forward direction this is the destination (target) geodetic datum.
When you use the ForwardOutputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property to set the forward output space geodetic datum, the string assigned to this property must be an alpha-numeric character string that matches one of those within the GeodeticDatumStrings collection.
member.remarks: Named horizontal geodetic datums are defined in the NamedHDatum.ini configuration file.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.ForwardOutputSpaceGeodeticDatumVal
member.summary:
Sets the forward output space horizontal geodetic datum used by the DatumTransformation object by assigning a predefined geodetic datum constant to the property. This property also returns the constant value for the currently assigned forward output space horizontal geodetic datum.
When transforming in the forward direction this is the destination (target) geodetic datum.
member.remarks: This property cannot be used to specify a named datum from the NamedHDatum.ini configuration file. The ForwardOutputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property must be used to specify a named datum. When the ForwardOutputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property is used to specify a named datum this property returns the value csgdNamed, which by itself is an ambiguous definition of the forward output space horizontal geodetic datum. When the value csgdNamed is obtained, the caller must then reference the ForwardOutputSpaceGeodeticDatumStr property to obtain a nonambiguous definition of the forward output space geodetic datum.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.GeodeticDatumStrings
member.summary: Returns a collection that enumerates the list of available geodetic datums.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.ModelTypeStr
member.summary:
Sets the horizontal geodetic datum transformation model used by the DatumTransformation object by specifying a character string from a standard list of horizontal geodetic datum transformation model character string names. This property also returns the character string for the currently assigned horizontal geodetic datum transformation model.
If the ModelTypeStr property is used to set the horizontal geodetic datum transformation model, the string assigned to this property must be an alphanumeric character string that matches one of those within the DatumTransModelTypeStrings collection.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.ModelTypeVal
member.summary: Sets the horizontal geodetic datum transformation model used by the DatumTransformation object by assigning a predefined model constant to the property. This property also returns the constant value for the currently assigned horizontal geodetic datum transformation model.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.MultipleRegression
member.summary: Returns the MultipleRegression object for a DatumTransformation object, which defines parameters specific to the Multiple Regression geodetic datum transformation model. If the current transformation model is not csdtMultipleRegression, this property raises an exception.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets an information string that can be used to hold a name for this particular horizontal datum transformation model and its parameters.
member.remarks: There is no maximum size for Name other than machine limitations.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.SecondDegreePolynomial
member.summary: Returns the SecondDegreePolynomial object for a DatumTransformation object. This object defines parameters specific to the Second Degree Polynomial geodetic datum transformation model. If the current transformation model is not csdt2ndDegConformalPolynomial or csdt2ndDegGeneralPolynomial, this property raises an exception.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.StandardMolodensky
member.summary: Returns the StandardMolodensky object for a DatumTransformation object. This object defines parameters specific to the Standard Molodensky geodetic datum transformation model. If the current transformation model is not csdtStandardMolodensky, this property raises an exception.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.DatumTransformation.UserSuppliedConfigurationParameters
member.summary:
Gets or sets the user-supplied transformation object which will be used to supply the datum transformation functionality, along with any other parameters that are required to configure the user-supplied object.
The string assigned to this property must be an alphanumeric character string that consists of a semicolon-delimited sequence of name-value pairs in the form of "name=value;". The first such name-value pair is required to have the name "ProgID," and its value specifies the ProgID for a user-created object which supplies the user-supplied datum transformation and has properties and methods conforming to the IGMUserSuppliedTransformation interface specification.

member.name: T:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf
member.summary: Defines parameters for the Bursa-Wolf datum transformation model. Bursa-Wolf has seven model parameters. The first three are shift parameters (between the centers of two ellipsoids that model the earth), the second three are rotations (Euler angles of rotation), and the last is the scale difference (between respective geocentric systems).

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf.DeltaScale
member.summary: Sets or gets the difference in scale between the initial Cartesian geocentric coordinate system and the resultant Cartesian geocentric system.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf.DeltaX
member.summary: Sets or gets the X translation between the centers of two reference ellipsoids used in definitions of the respective geodetic datums.
member.remarks: This property is always in meters.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf.DeltaY
member.summary: Sets or gets the Y translation between the centers of two reference ellipsoids used in definitions of the respective geodetic datums.
member.remarks: This property is always in meters.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf.DeltaZ
member.summary: Sets or gets the Z translation between the centers of two reference ellipsoids used in definitions of the respective geodetic datums.
member.remarks: This property is always in meters.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf.OmegaX
member.summary: Sets and gets the Euler Angle of rotation about the X-axis applied at the origin of the initial Cartesian geocentric coordinate system in order to bring it parallel to the resultant Cartesian geocentric coordinate system.
member.remarks: This property is always in radians.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf.OmegaY
member.summary: Sets and gets the Euler Angle of rotation about the Y-axis applied at the origin of the initial Cartesian geocentric coordinate system in order to bring it parallel to the resultant Cartesian geocentric coordinate system.
member.remarks: This property is always in radians.

member.name: P:Intergraph.CoordinateSystems.BursaWolf.OmegaZ
member.summary: Sets and gets the Euler Angle of rotation about the Z-axis applied at the origin of the initial Cartesian geocentric coordinate system in order to bring it parallel to the resultant Cartesian geocentric coordinate system.
member.remarks: This property is always in radians.
